title: Meta + DIN hybrid?
content:
Anything out there?

 [‹ Brochure design](http://web.archive.org/web/20071123092727/http:/typophile.com/node/39120 "Go to previous forum topic") [Anybody know GST Polo ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071123092727/http:/typophile.com/node/32095 "Go to next forum topic")
author: benski

comments.content:
Interesting request. The first thing that comes to mind is [Flama](http://web.archive.org/web/20071123092727/http:/www.vllg.com/Feliciano/Flama/mudTyper+Weights/).  
It’s tough to visualize what this would look like.  
A geometric face but a little more expressive?

[Camingo](http://web.archive.org/web/20071123092727/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/jan-fromm/camingo/)

[Klavika](http://web.archive.org/web/20071123092727/http:/www.processtypefoundry.com/typefaces/klavika/index.html)

[Beta Sans](http://web.archive.org/web/20071123092727/http:/www.shiftype.com/fontdetail.php?m=1&p=3)

[Reykjavik](http://web.archive.org/web/20071123092727/http:/www.psyops.com/html/spec_reykjavik1.html)
It’s sort of funny, when I first read this post I was thinking about the type types being antithetical, and now I’m sketching up a design.
The Klavika (Process Type) is a really nice font. To my eyes, it has a technical touch and is working fine as Display font (of course you can use it for copy as well).
